chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
items.plainText: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

items.text: And Job spake, and said,
items.plainText: And Job spake, and said,

items.text: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
items.plainText: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.

items.text: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
items.plainText: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

items.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
items.plainText: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

items.text: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
items.plainText: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.

items.text: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.
items.plainText: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

items.text: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
items.plainText: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.

items.text: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:
items.plainText: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:

items.text: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother's womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
items.plainText: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother's womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

items.text: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
items.plainText: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

items.text: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?
items.plainText: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

items.text: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
items.plainText: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

items.text: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;
items.plainText: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

items.text: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
items.plainText: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

items.text: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.
items.plainText: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.

items.text: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
items.plainText: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

items.text: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
items.plainText: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

items.text: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.
items.plainText: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.

items.text: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
items.plainText: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;

items.text: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;
items.plainText: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;

items.text: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
items.plainText: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

items.text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
items.plainText: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

items.text: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
items.plainText: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.

items.text: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
items.plainText: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.

items.text: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
items.plainText: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
